headline: PepsiCo Snack Price Cuts Test Margins While Targeting Volume And Loyalty
summary: PepsiCo (NasdaqGS:PEP) is introducing price cuts of up to 15% on major snack brands such as Doritos and Lay's. The company is pairing these pricing moves with a focus on accessibility and product innovation, as outlined by the CEO. These actions follow strong Q4 results and are aimed at improving affordability for middle and lower income consumers. For you as an investor, this puts the spotlight on how a large consumer staples group like PepsiCo is responding to price sensitivity in snacks...

headline: Coca-Cola forecasts sluggish revenue growth in 2026
summary: STORY: Coca-Cola on Tuesday missed Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter revenue.It also forecast muted growth for 2026, as demand weakened in North America and Asia.The news sent its shares down about 4% in premarket trading.The company has been raising prices for its beverages to offset higher input costs.But it comes at a time when U.S. consumers are increasingly looking for cheaper options as inflation squeezes budgets.Rival PepsiCo said last week it would cut prices on key snacks such as Lay's and Doritos.Consumers had pushed back against several rounds of price hikes over the last few years.Coca-Cola expects 2026 organic revenue to grow 4% to 5%, compared with a 5% rise last year.The company reported fourth-quarter revenue of $11.82 billion, missing estimates of just over $12 billion.

raw.headline: Coca-Cola forecasts sluggish revenue growth in 2026
raw.summary: STORY: Coca-Cola on Tuesday missed Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter revenue.It also forecast muted growth for 2026, as demand weakened in North America and Asia.The news sent its shares down about 4% in premarket trading.The company has been raising prices for its beverages to offset higher input costs.But it comes at a time when U.S. consumers are increasingly looking for cheaper options as inflation squeezes budgets.Rival PepsiCo said last week it would cut prices on key snacks such as Lay's and Doritos.Consumers had pushed back against several rounds of price hikes over the last few years.Coca-Cola expects 2026 organic revenue to grow 4% to 5%, compared with a 5% rise last year.The company reported fourth-quarter revenue of $11.82 billion, missing estimates of just over $12 billion.

headline: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From PepsiCo’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: PepsiCo’s fourth quarter results received a strong market response, with revenue growth surpassing Wall Street expectations and non-GAAP earnings per share also slightly above consensus. Management attributed the performance to targeted affordability initiatives, productivity improvements, and double-digit shelf space gains, particularly in Frito-Lay. CEO Ramon Laguarta emphasized the company’s “multi-vector strategy” to drive category growth, focusing on both affordability for low- and middle-i
